column4: Apple battling U.S.  states over proposed e-book limits
column5: NEW YORK Apple Inc is headed for a showdown with the U.S. government and dozens of states  which on Friday urged that tough new restrictions be imposed on the company for illegally conspiring to raise e-book prices.

column4: UPDATE 4-Apple battling U.S.  states over proposed e-book limits
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 2 Apple Inc is headed for a showdown with the U.S.  government and dozens of states  which on Friday urged that tough new restrictions be imposed on the company for illegally conspiring to raise e-book prices.

column4: U.S.  states propose remedy for Apple e-book price-fixing
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 2 Apple Inc deserves a five-year ban from entering anticompetitive e-book distribution contracts  and should also end its business arrangements with five major publishers with which it conspired to raise e-book prices  federal and state regulators said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Green Plains to temporarily shut down nine ethanol plants -CEO
column5: Aug 2 Corn-based ethanol maker Green Plains Renewable Energy will temporarily shut down nine of its 10 ethanol plants for maintenance during the next two months as corn supplies tighten ahead of the U.S. harvest  Chief Executive Officer Todd Becker said in an interview on Friday.

column4: Pimco Total Return Fund suffers $7.5 billion outflow in July: Morningstar
column5: NEW YORK Bill Gross's Pimco Total Return Fund  the world's largest mutual fund  suffered an outflow of $7.5 billion in July after investors pulled a record sum from the fund in June  data from Morningstar showed on Friday.

column4: Fisher Communications shareholders want more from Sinclair to sell
column5: Three minority shareholders of Fisher Communications Inc said a $373 million takeover bid by Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc undervalues the TV broadcaster and are looking to activist investor Mario Gabelli to derail the offer.

column5: Aug 2 Three minority shareholders of Fisher Communications Inc said a $373 million takeover bid by Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc undervalues the TV broadcaster and are looking to activist investor Mario Gabelli to derail the offer.

column4: Kabel Deutschland board formally recommends Vodafone offer
column5: FRANKFURT The supervisory and management boards of Kabel Deutschland have formally recommended a 7.7 billion euro ($10.2 billion) bid from Vodafone  they said in a statement on Friday.

column4: Aetna exits Obamacare exchange in Maryland over price
column5: Aetna Inc pulled out of Maryland's health insurance exchange being created under President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law after the state pressed it to lower its proposed rates by up to 29 percent.

column4: UPDATE 2-Aetna exits Obamacare exchange in Maryland over price
column5: Aug 2 Aetna Inc pulled out of Maryland's health insurance exchange being created under President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law after the state pressed it to lower its proposed rates by up to 29 percent.

column4: Aetna pulls out of Maryland health exchange
column5: Aug 2 Aetna Inc has pulled its applications to sell insurance plans on Maryland's individual health exchange after it was asked to lower its rates by up to 29 percent from what it had requested  according to the state's department of insurance.

column4: REFILE-Bankers blindsided by Air Products' activist upset
column5: LONDON  Aug 2 (IFR) - Midsummer monotony in the corporate bond market was broken this week when Air Products and Chemicals first euro bond issuance in six years was knocked off track by an unexpected swoop on the business by activist shareholder Bill Ackman.

column4: American Axle co-founder Richard Dauch dies at 71
column5: DETROIT Richard "Dick" Dauch  the outspoken and hard-charging co-founder and executive chairman of American Axle & Manufacturing Holdings   whose automotive career spanned about 50 years  died on Friday at age 71.

column4: RPT-UPDATE 5-Michael Dell closes in on prize with sweeter $25 bln deal
column5: NEW YORK/ROUND ROCK  Texas  Aug 2 Dell Inc  and Chief Executive Michael Dell clinched a new $25 billion deal on Friday  boosting the bid and offering a special dividend in hopes of ending months of wrangling with opponents of the founder's proposed buyout of the world's No. 3 PC maker.

column4: Dell shareholders convene a third time as buyout battle escalates
column5: ROUND ROCK  TEXAS/SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 2 Dell Inc  shareholders convene for a third time on Friday to vote on CEO Michael Dell's $24.4 billion buyout  helping decide the fate of the No. 3 PC maker after months of dueling with Carl Icahn and other unhappy investors.

column5: NEW YORK Investors in small-cap funds may be in for a big surprise.

column4: Spicy earnings  outlook lift shares in Chili's Grill owner to new high
column5: Chili's Grill & Bar parent Brinker International Inc  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit and forecast higher earnings for fiscal 2014  sending its shares up as much as 8 percent to an all-time high.

column4: CBS goes dark in NY  LA as Time Warner Cable talks collapse
column5: CBS went dark for millions of Time Warner Cable subscribers on Friday after the cable operator and the network's parent company CBS Corp failed to reach an agreement over fees after weeks of contentious negotiations.

column4: Chevron profit drops on cheaper oil  slim refining margins
column5: Chevron Corp  posted on Friday a steeper-than-expected 26 percent drop in quarterly profit on softer oil prices and thinner refining margins.

column4: UPDATE 3-Chevron profit drops on cheaper oil  slim refining margins
column5: By Braden Reddall     Aug 2 Chevron Corp posted on Friday a steeper-than-expected 26 percent drop in quarterly profit on softer oil prices and thinner refining margins.     Shares of the second-largest U.S. oil company slipped 2 percent as quarterly oil and gas volumes weakened to a level well below Chevron's full-year target.     Achieving increased production from oil wells has been a struggle for Chevron and larger rival Exxon Mobil Corp  which reported disappointing results on Th

column4: Chevron Q2 earnings drop on cheaper oil  maintenance
column5: Aug 2 Chevron Corp posted a decline in quarterly profit on Friday after maintenance work and a fall in oil prices knocked global oil and gas production.     Second-quarter net income fell 26 percent to $5.37 billion  or $2.77 per share  from $7.21 billion  or $3.66 per share  a year earlier. Analysts  on average  expected $2.96 per share  according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S.

column4: CVS Caremark set to pay $20 million to resolve SEC investigation
column5: CVS Caremark Corp said on Friday that it plans to pay a $20 million civil penalty to resolve a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission investigation into 2009 comments and staff securities transactions and its accounting for an acquisition.

column4: Duke Energy shelves major nuclear project in Florida
column5: MIAMI Duke Energy Corp said on Thursday it will not proceed with a $24 billion nuclear power project in central Florida because of licensing delays and doubts about cost recovery  but may use the site for nuclear power generation in the future.

column5: Diversified manufacturer Eaton Corp  reported a lower-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday and cut the top end of its full-year earnings outlook  citing slower market growth.

column4: UPDATE 4-Eaton gives downbeat outlook as profit misses forecasts
column5: By Lewis Krauskopf     Aug 2 Diversified manufacturer Eaton Corp  reported a lower-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday and cut the top end of its full-year earnings outlook  citing slower market growth.         Shares fell more than 5 percent  as the maker of electrical and hydraulic systems said quarterly sales would have declined 2 percent without the help of acquisitions.     Eaton Chief Executive Sandy Cutler said the company's markets were now expected to rise only 1 percen

column5: Aug 2 Diversified manufacturer Eaton Corp  on Friday reported a quarterly profit that missed Wall Street forecasts  and it cut the top end of its full-year earnings outlook  citing lower expected market growth.

column4: UPDATE 1-Eldorado profit falls  plans less generous dividends
column5: Aug 2 Canada's Eldorado Gold Corp   reported a decline in second-quarter profit on Friday despite a big increase in production  as the price of gold dropped  and the company revised its dividend policy.

column4: Eldorado profit falls  plans less generous dividends
column5: Aug 2 Eldorado Gold Corp reported a small decline in second quarter profit on Friday despite a big increase in production  as the price of gold dropped  and the company revised its dividend policy.

column4: Freeport Indonesia says underground mine running at 50 pct capacity
column5: JAKARTA  Aug 2 Underground production at Freeport McMoRan Copper and Gold Inc's Indonesian unit is running at 50 percent of capacity  a spokeswoman said  adding that it would take "a couple of months" before full capacity would be reached.

column4: General Dynamics wins $212 million deal for U.S. destroyer deckhouse
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. military shipbuilder General Dynamics Corp  has won a contract valued at $212 million to design and construct a new steel deckhouse for the third Zumwalt-class destroyer it is building in Bath  Maine  the Pentagon said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 2-General Dynamics wins $212 mln deal for U.S. destroyer deckhouse
column5: WASHINGTON  Aug 2 U.S. military shipbuilder General Dynamics Corp has won a contract valued at $212 million to design and construct a new steel deckhouse for the third Zumwalt-class destroyer it is building in Bath  Maine  the Pentagon said on Friday.

column4: General Dynamics wins $212 mln contract for U.S. destroyer deckhouse

column4: GM splits China from international unit  hires former Volvo CEO
column5: DETROIT General Motors Co  said on Friday it has split the critical China operations from its international unit  which will now be run by the former chief executive of Swedish automaker Volvo.

column4: GM splits China from international unit  hires former Volvo CEO

column4: India revokes GSK cancer drug patent in latest Big Pharma blow
column5: MUMBAI India has revoked a patent granted to GlaxoSmithKline Plc for breast cancer drug Tykerb  a decision that follows a landmark India court ruling disallowing patents for incremental innovations that was a blow to global pharmaceutical firms.

column4: UPDATE 2-India revokes GSK cancer drug patent in latest Big Pharma blow
column5: * Ruling follows Supreme Court decision on Glivec in April

column4: India board revokes GSK patent on breast cancer drug Tykerb
column5: MUMBAI  Aug 2 India's patent appeals board has revoked a patent granted to GlaxoSmithKline Plc's breast cancer drug Tykerb  which is a salt form of the original compound  lapatinib.

column4: U.S. judge tosses out Goldman ruling  points to arbitrator
column5: A federal judge late on Thursday tossed out a securities arbitration ruling against an investor who sought to recoup $1.4 million from Goldman Sachs Group Inc  citing an arbitrator's failure to fully disclose his involvement in an unrelated criminal proceeding  according to a court opinion.

column5: * PRA sees 27-29 billion pound shortfall for investment banks

column4: Cross-border M&A falls to lowest since 2009
column5: LONDON Cross-border merger and acquisition deal volumes are down by almost a third so far this year from 2012 levels  making this the slowest year to date for international transactions since 2009  Thomson Reuters data showed on Friday.

column4: Lloyds to exit Australia with sale of leasing unit  loans: sources
column5: SYDNEY Britain's Lloyds Banking Group  is preparing to exit the Australian market  seeking to sell a leasing unit with a book value of $3.6 billion and a $625 million institutional loan portfolio  three sources familiar with the situation said on Friday.

column4: Honda says July China auto sales down 1.7 percent on year
column5: SHANGHAI Honda Motor Co Ltd  and its two local joint-ventures sold 51 140 automobiles in China in July  down 1.7 percent from a year earlier  the Japanese automaker said on Friday.

column4: HSBC replaces long-time auditor KPMG with PwC
column5: LONDON HSBC Holdings  said PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) will be its auditor from 2015  replacing KPMG  in the first change by a major UK bank after calls from regulators for firms to change their accountants more regularly.

column5: MUMBAI India's Exide Industries Ltd  is in talks with Manulife Financial Corp  as well as Samsung Life Insurance Co  to sell a 26 percent stake in its life insurance unit  two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

column5: NEW YORK  Aug 2 With earnings season winding down and the employment report out of the way  the U.S. stock market is likely to shift into a lower gear next week.

column4: McKesson directors re-elected with solid majority
column5: Aug 2 Drug distributor McKesson Corp  revealed shareholder voting results on Friday that showed all of its directors  who faced opposition from prominent proxy advisory firms and investors  were re-elected with solid majorities.

column4: Russian miner Mechel says Q2 coal output up 9 pct q/q
column5: MOSCOW  Aug 2 Indebted Russian miner Mechel   said on Friday second-quarter coal production rose 9 percent quarter-on-quarter to 7 million tonnes.

column4: Morgan Stanley sets aside $199 million more for litigation costs
column5: NEW YORK Morgan Stanley  set aside an additional $199 million for expected litigation expenses in the second quarter  much higher than the $4 million increase it reported in the year-ago period  the bank said on Friday.

column4: Investment banks in UK face capital shortfall: central bank
column5: LONDON Foreign investment banks in Britain face a shortfall of up to 29 billion pounds to meet new EU capital rules aimed at shielding taxpayers from having to rescue banks again  the Bank of England said on Friday.

column4: Morgan Stanley to meet 5 pct leverage ratio by 2015-executive
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 2 Morgan Stanley's holding company will reach a proposed 5 percent supplementary leverage ratio by 2015  and its U.S. deposit-taking subsidiaries are already above the 6 percent requirement  the bank's treasurer  David Russo  said on Friday.

column4: Cross-border M&A falls to lowest since 2009
column5: LONDON Cross-border merger and acquisition deal volumes are down by almost a third so far this year from 2012 levels  making this the slowest year to date for international transactions since 2009  Thomson Reuters data showed on Friday.

column4: Och-Ziff posts stronger profit  tops estimates
column5: BOSTON Och-Ziff Capital Management Group LLC  posted higher-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday  beating expectations as the hedge fund company earned more in fees and paid less in taxes.

column4: Nikkei posts biggest rise in 5 weeks; US growth optimism  weaker yen buoy
column5: TOKYO  Aug 2 Japan's Nikkei share average surged 3.3 percent  its biggest one-day rise in five weeks  helped by a rally in global markets after strong U.S. economic data  a weaker yen and some upbeat earnings reports from companies like Sony Corp.     The benchmark Nikkei was up 460.39 points at 14 466.16  finishing above 14 400 for the first time since July 25. It advanced 2.4 percent on the week after losing 3.2 percent in the prior week.
